titleStmt.title: Samuel G. Suddarth, Receipt to Barnard Mattingly
CWG13801

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.idno: QMG Box 10; Folder 1865 Telegraphing, State Guards, Printing, Hospital, Office Expenses, Services Rendered; Left Stack

body.p:
No. 22.
The State of Kentucky,
To Barnard Mattingly Dr

row.cell: To Services rendered and money expended in recruiting & subsisting twenty one men for the six months State service from the 6" day of May 1864 to the 5" day of July 1864, the date from which his commission dates as 1st Lt. Co. "H" Capital Guards Ky

body.p: I Certify that the above account is correct and just; that the services were rendered as stated; and that they were necessary for the public service.

S. G. Suddarth
Quarter-Master Gen. of Ky.

Received at Frankfort, Kentucky, the 31 of Jany, 1865, of S. G. SUDDARTH, Quarter-Master General of the State of Kentucky, the sum of One hundred & Eighty Dollars and -- Cents, in full of the above account.

No. 22.
No. 75 ^74^ Abstract B Qr. 186.
B. Mattingly
Dollars 180 00/100
Paid January 31, 1865.
Recruiting
Certificate no 88
